intro: Echites angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Echites angustifolius is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
